content:
I couldn't find a defined CodeSystem URI for ICD-O-3 and i see the need to define this as it is a very important CS in the oncology space.
@May Terry @Halina Labikova @Mark Kramer did you create your own URI for icd-o-3 ?

I think the only official uri would be based on the "2.16.840.1.113883.6.43.1" oid. See https://www.hl7.org/documentcenter/public/standards/vocabulary/vocabulary_tables/infrastructure/vocabulary/voc_ExternalSystems.html

@Patrick Werner We did not use or assign a code system URL because we couldn't incorporate codes from ICD-O-3 for copyright reasons. It's a proprietary (and legacy, not being updated) vocabulary. We referred to ICD-O-3 only in our documentation.
In Germany the usage of ICD-O-3 is mandatory in the context of cancer registries. The license is distributed by the german DIMDI Institute.
Independently from the copyright reasons i think we should define an URI for icd-o-3. Snomed also has a URI and isn't public domain.
@Grahame Grieve any news from the WHO about ICD10/ICD-O-3 licensing for HL7/FHIR?
thanks for the reminder. I'll push things along...
there's 2 different questions - we can assign a URI without copyright issues. It's including them in the IGs and/or supporting them in the publication system that requires copyright agreement
for the URI.. I would prefer http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ICD-O-3 - very straight forward.
but could also use urn:oid:2.16.840.1.113883.6.43.1 too.
as for german usage.. what is the license terms under which DIMDI distributes it?
Please, please, please let's avoid oid-based systems if humanly possible...

Will go with http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ICD-O-3 for now.
The german license: https://www.dimdi.de/static/.downloads/english/terms-of-distribution.pdf
i just saw icd-o-3 is missing in the terms pdf, i think that's not intended to miss but was just forgotten to add. Will ask the Dimdi.
found it: https://www.dimdi.de/static/.downloads/deutsch/downloadbedingungen-icd-o-3.pdf (german only but same terms)
https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-26323
yes so I was afraid of that - the license only allows use within the borders of Germany (not use anywhere for the purpose of use within Germany) - (let me know if my translation is deficient)
your translation is right. This only allows the usage inside of Germany
like CPT-4. well... can't help from outside then. Do they really want to exclude cloud usage? Or do they actually only mean 'only use for coding'?
On a similar note - can I count on CodeSystem for AJCC's staging elements to be "http://cancerstaging.org" ?
I don't think you can count on that. you can certainly create a task for vocab to consider it

Grahame Grieve said:

for the URI.. I would prefer http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ICD-O-3 - very straight forward.

@Noemi Deppenwiese found this one: https://terminology.hl7.org/2.1.0/CodeSystem-icd-o-3.html which states the SID: http://terminology.hl7.org/CodeSystem/icd-o-3
So the above mentioned url isn't valid (note for future readers of this thread)
